text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Regulated Professions (Health and 
Social Care) (Amendment) Act 2020 (Commencement of Certain Provisions) 
Order 2022.
text_norm: 1 order may cited regulated profession (health social care) (amendment) act 2020 (commencement certain provisions) order 2022

title: Social Care) (Amendment) Act 2020 (Commencement of Certain Provisions)
heading: 2. The 14th day of March 2022 is appointed as the day on which the
text_raw:
2. The 14th day of March 2022 is appointed as the day on which the 
following provisions of the Regulated Professions (Health and Social Care) 
(Amendment) Act 2020 (No. 16 of 2020) shall come into operation: 

(a) paragraphs (b) and (c) of section 84; 

(b) paragraph (g)(i) of section 109; 

(c) 

sections 120 and 121; 

(d) 

sections 123 to 130. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

10 March, 2022. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 15th March, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [115] 3

title: Social Care) (Amendment) Act 2020 (Commencement of Certain Provisions)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order appoints the 14th of March 2022 as the day on which certain 
sections of the Regulated Professions (Health and Social Care) (Amendment) 
Act 2020 come into operation. These sections introduce certain changes to the 
structure of committees of the Medical Council and have the effect of 
providing that a medical practitioner has a right of appeal to the High Court 
where the sanctions of advice, admonishment or censure in writing are imposed 
by the Medical Council. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [115]
